creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: head and shoulders of a woman with her hair up, holding an orange and blue cloth with floral patterns; woman wears a black kimono with orange and blue butterflies and a gold ring with a blue stone
inscription: 大正九年十月 {Taishō kunen jūgatsu} (October 1920)
markings: red artist\'s seal: はしぐち五葉 {Hashiguchi Goyō}; LLC: red artist\'s seal: はしぐち {Hashiguchi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper with mica
provenance:
Unknown red seal on back that could be from a collector.
Frederick Brown Wells III
Joan B Mirviss LTD. until 6/30/1984
Christie's until 6/27/1984 (Lot #111 at Christie's auction in 6/26/1984)
text: Artwork dated to October 1920 but was posthumously printed in the early 1950s. Portrait of the Shinbashi geisha Hisae ひさゑ.
title: Woman Holding a Hand Towel
